com.gdxgame.core

Class GameStateLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
      • com.gdxgame.core.GameInputAdapter
        • com.gdxgame.core.GameStateLogic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.controllers.ControllerListener, InputProcessor

    public abstract class GameStateLogic
extends GameInputAdapter
    GameStateLogic is one of the core classes besides GameState to handle game states. Each game consists of multiple gamestates (f.e. show main menu, game, show highscore, game over, ...). Each GameState has its own resources (f.e. audio or graphic files that are important for that state) and its own GameStateLogic instance. The GameStateLogic instance is used to handle the real logic of the game state while the GameState instance is used to handle the resource management.

    It extends the GameInputAdapter class to listen to keyboard,mouse,touch and controller events.

    A GameStateLogic is configured (=which logic is used for which gamestate) within the GameStateType enum.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        automatically called whenever the GameState.show() method is called and the logic was not initialized yet. Initializes the game state logic.

      • update

        public abstract void update(float deltaTime)
        automatically called whenever the GameState.update(float) method is called. Updates the game state logic.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - time passed since last frame

      • render

        public abstract void render(SpriteBatch spriteBatch)
        automatically called whenever the GameState.render(SpriteBatch) method is called. Renders the game state logic.
        Parameters:
        spriteBatch - reference to the GDXGame SpriteBatch to draw things

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        automatically called whenever the GameState.resize(int, int) method is called. Handles any resize logic.
        Parameters:
        width - new window width
        height - new window height

      • pause

        public void pause()
        automatically called whenever the GameState.hide() or GameState.pause() method is called. It can be followed by a call to dispose() if the game state logic is no longer needed. Pauses the game state logic.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        automatically called whenever the GameState.show() or GameState.resume() method is called. Resumes the game state logic.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()
        automatically called whenever the GameState.dispose() method is called. Disposes all resources of the game state logic.
